1.brief: but, on the other hand, and
1.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
a day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

1.brief: I come into being, am born
1.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.
a Hellenist, Grecian Jew, a Greek-speaking Jew, that is one who can speak Greek only and not Hebrew (or Aramaic).
a Hebrew, particularly one who speaks Hebrew (Aramaic).
that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.
waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration.

1.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
1.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

2.brief: but, on the other hand, and
2.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to.
a multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
I leave behind, desert, abandon, forsake; I leave remaining, reserve.

2.brief: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy
2.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.
I wait at table (particularly of a slave who waits on guests); I serve (generally).

2.brief: a table for food or business
2.long: a table, (a) for food or banqueting, (b) for money-changing or business.

3.brief: I look upon, visit, look out, select
3.long: I look upon, visit, look out, select.

3.brief: but, on the other hand, and
3.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

3.brief: a male human being, a man
3.long: a male human being; a man, husband.

3.brief: from out, out from among, from
3.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
I witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report.
full, abounding in, complete, completely occupied with.
wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence.
I set down, bring down to a place; I set in order, appoint, make, constitute.

3.brief: on, to, against, on the basis of, at
3.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.

4.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
(a) prayer (to God), (b) a place for prayer (used by Jews, perhaps where there was no synagogue).
waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration.

4.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.
I persist, persevere in, continue steadfast in; I wait upon.

5.long: and, even, also, namely.
I please, with the idea of willing service rendered to others; hence almost: I serve.
the, the definite article.

the, the definite article.
a multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage.
and, even, also, namely.

full, abounding in, complete, completely occupied with.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
and, even, also, namely.
wind, breath, spirit.

Philip, (a) one of the twelve apostles of Jesus, (b) tetrarch of the Ituraean and Trachonitic region, half-brother of Herod Antipas, tetrarch of Galilee, (c) one of the seven original deacons at Jerusalem and a missionary.
and, even, also, namely.
Prochorus, one of the seven original deacons at Jerusalem.
and, even, also, namely.
Nicanor, a proper name.
and, even, also, namely.
Timon, one of the seven original deacons at Jerusalem.
and, even, also, namely.
Parmenas, one of the original seven deacons at Jerusalem.
and, even, also, namely.
Nicolaus, a proper name.
(lit: that has come to), a proselyte, that is a non-Jew, who has been circumcised and has adopted the Jews' religion.
an Antiochian, an inhabitant of Antioch.

6.long: trans: (a) I make to stand, place, set up, establish, appoint; mid: I place myself, stand, (b) I set in balance, weigh; intrans: (c) I stand, stand by, stand still; met: I stand ready, stand firm, am steadfast.

6.brief: before the face of, in the presence of
6.long: before the face of, in the presence of, in the eyes of.

6.brief: an apostle, a messenger, an envoy, a delegate
6.long: a messenger, envoy, delegate, one commissioned by another to represent him in some way, especially a man sent out by Jesus Christ Himself to preach the Gospel; an apostle.
I pray, pray for, offer prayer.

6.brief: I put, place upon, lay on
6.long: I put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition.

6.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
6.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

7.brief: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy
7.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.

7.brief: I cause to increase, become greater, grow
7.long: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow.
(Aramaic form), Jerusalem, the capital of Palestine: hence Judaism, and allegorically, Christendom, the Christian Church.
a crowd, mob, the common people.
a priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.).
I listen, hearken to, obey, answer.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

8.long: Stephen, one of the seven original deacons at Jerusalem, and the first martyr.

8.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
full, abounding in, complete, completely occupied with.
(a) grace, as a gift or blessing brought to man by Jesus Christ, (b) favor, (c) gratitude, thanks, (d) a favor, kindness.
(a) physical power, force, might, ability, efficacy, energy, meaning (b) plur: powerful deeds, deeds showing (physical) power, marvelous works.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause.
a sign, miracle, indication, mark, token.
large, great, in the widest sense.
(a) a people, characteristically of God's chosen people, first the Jews, then the Christians, (b) sometimes, but rarely, the people, the crowd.

9.brief: I raise up, set up, rise from
9.long: I raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear.

9.brief: but, on the other hand, and
9.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.

9.brief: from out, out from among, from
9.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
an assembly, congregation, synagogue, either the place or the people gathered together in the place.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
a freedman, one of the class of manumitted slaves; a synagogue at Jerusalem appears to have been reserved for them.
an Alexandrian, a native (or resident) of Alexandria in Egypt.
Cilicia, a Roman province between the Taurus range of mountains and the coast in the south-east corner of Asia Minor, linked up with the province of Syria.

9.brief: roughly the western third of Asia Minor
9.long: the Roman province of Asia, roughly the western third of Asia Minor.
Stephen, one of the seven original deacons at Jerusalem, and the first martyr.

10.long: I have strength, am strong, am in full health and vigor, am able; meton: I prevail.

10.brief: I take a stand against, oppose, resist
10.long: I set against; I withstand, resist, oppose.
wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence.
(I talk, chatter in classical Greek, but in NT a more dignified word) I speak, say.

11.long: I throw or put under; met: I subject, submit, suggest, whisper, prompt, suborn, instigate.

11.long: a male human being; a man, husband.

a thing spoken, (a) a word or saying of any kind, as command, report, promise, (b) a thing, matter, business.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
Moses; met: the books of Moses, the Pentateuch.

12.long: I move together, stir up, excite.
(a) a people, characteristically of God's chosen people, first the Jews, then the Christians, (b) sometimes, but rarely, the people, the crowd.
elder, usually used as subst.; an elder, a member of the Sanhedrin, an elder of a Christian assembly.

12.brief: a scribe, town-clerk, man of learning
12.long: (a) in Jerusalem, a scribe, one learned in the Jewish Law, a religious teacher, (b) at Ephesus, the town-clerk, the secretary of the city, (c) a man of learning generally.

12.brief: I stand by, am urgent, befall one, impend
12.long: I stand by, am urgent, befall one (as of evil), am at hand, impend.

12.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
12.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
I lead, lead away, bring (a person, or animal), guide, spend a day, go.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
a council, tribunal; the Sanhedrin, the meeting place of the Sanhedrin.

and, both.
a witness; an eye- or ear-witness.
false, deceitful, lying, untrue.

a place, region, seat; an opportunity.
